page.title: 20 NATURALIST RESERVES
page.content: The preservation of NATURAL ENVIRONMENTS with rare fauna & flora is one of our SOCIAL CONCERNS nowadays. To this end the Berkshire,Buckingham- shire and Oxfordshire Naturalist Trust (BBONT)has been set up. In our area BBONT has 3 reserves: 1) Dry Sandford Pits(G.R.467995) an area of 8 hectares(ha.)consisting of an old sand and limestone quarry,which has a lake covering a 1/4 of the site and woodland,scrub,fen,heath and grassland on the rest.Interesting FLORA includes in the marshy area Orchids and around the lake willow and birch.Dragon-and damsel flies;99 varieties of bees and wasps;Marbled White butterflies;Great Green Bush Crickets are examples of the FAUNA to be found.2)Hitchcopse Pit(G.R. 452996 0.8ha) old sandpit with pond and reedbed.3)Parsonage Moor(G.R.461998 12 ha) with interesting peat formations.
